channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump draws up plans to punish China over coronavirus pandemic
item.description: The Trump administration is formulating a long-term plan to punish China on multiple fronts for the coronavirus pandemic, injecting a rancorous new element into a critical relationship already on a steep downward slide.

item.title: Russia's PM tests positive. UK is 'past its peak', Johnson says. WHO issues warning on Europe.
Deaths soar in a country that didn't lock down. Officials identify big reason why.
Read this before you venture out in public
item.description: The best way to curb the spread of Covid-19 is to stay home if you can.

item.title: Trump and Kushner show depth of disconnect with Americans on the front lines
Hilton CEO shatters Trump's testing conspiracy theory while sitting beside him
item.description: At a White House meeting with corporate executives on Wednesday, President Donald Trump repeated his conspiratorial suggestion that the media is talking about a lack of coronavirus testing to try to damage him politically.

item.title: Donald Trump: I didn't say it. (He did. Here's the tape.)
item.description: President Donald Trump falsely claims that he didn't say the US will get to 5 million daily coronavirus tests soon. CNN's Brooke Baldwin and Dr. Sanjay Gupta replay that tape.

item.title: Welcome to the worst economy ever
Wuhan shows world that normal might still be a long way off
Anger rises among Russia's doctors as coronavirus hospitals get put on lockdown
item.description: The coronavirus pandemic has put the spotlight on the risks faced by frontline health workers, and Russia is no exception. Medical facilities in the country have emerged as one of the main breeding grounds for Covid-19, and two dozen hospitals have had to shut down for long quarantines, with many doctors falling sick.

item.title: Where did it go wrong for the UK?
Pelosi remains 'satisfied' with Biden's response to sexual assault allegation
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi reiterated Thursday she's "satisfied" with how Joe Biden has responded to a sexual assault allegation from a former Senate staffer despite mounting calls for the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee to more directly address the issue.

item.title: Eye-opening South Korea study on Covid-19
item.description: The most complicated issue in America right now is how, when and where to reopen the cities and towns that have been sheltered in place. Everyone wants resumption of the mobile life of social proximity we enjoyed a few months ago but balancing this against the competing need to assure both individual safety and -- because this is a contagious disease -- societal safety remains a substantial challenge.

item.title: NYT: Trump officials pushing intelligence agencies to tie coronavirus to Chinese labs
item.description: A number of top officials in the Trump administration have pushed US intelligence agencies looking into the origin of the novel coronavirus to "hunt for evidence" linking the virus to a Chinese laboratory, The New York Times reported Thursday.

item.title: The problem with the Covid-19 death numbers
item.description: After Hurricane Maria hit Puerto Rico, many journalists, community leaders and activists all had the same suspicion. More people were dying than the U.S. government was saying.

item.title: Thousands rally to cheer up 'despondent' coronavirus patient, 79, after doctor's appeal
item.description: Medical staff around the world are doing their best to deal with the coronavirus, and one Spanish doctor found the time to go the extra mile for a patient in need of some motivation.

item.title: The star gymnast who reinvented herself as a porn actress
item.description: The simple act of cartwheeling at the age of five begins Verona van de Leur's story, a childhood passion which in turn led to a desire to be an Olympic gymnast.

item.title: Germany bans Lebanese militant group Hezbollah and raids mosques and homes
item.description: Germany announced Thursday it has designated the Lebanese militant and political group Hezbollah a terror organization, banning all of its activities in the country and ordering raids on sites police say are linked to the group.

item.title: One of the biggest pieces of the moon is up for sale
item.description: A piece of the moon that's bigger than the rocks Apollo astronauts brought back to Earth is up for sale at the famed Christie's auction house.

item.title: Trump calls newly released UFO footage 'a hell of a video'
item.description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday called footage from the Pentagon showing "unidentified aerial phenomena" a "hell of a video" and told Reuters he wonders "if it's real."

item.title: F-18 pilots on spotting UFOs: There's a whole fleet of them!
item.description: The Department of Defense has confirmed that three UFO videos made public over the past several years do indeed show "unidentified aerial phenomena."

item.title: Highest ever concentration of microplastics found on seafloor
item.description: The level of microplastics on the seafloor is at its highest ever level, with up to 1.9 million pieces covering just one square meter.

item.title: Trump's 2020 attack strategy against Biden is straight from his 2016 playbook
Bollywood actor Rishi Kapoor dies age 67, a day after Irrfan Khan
Coronavirus is 'emboldening' Myanmar military to carry out 'war crimes' says UN human rights expert
item.description: A leading United Nations human rights expert claims the Myanmar military is carrying out "war crimes" against ethnic minorities, emboldened by special extended powers intended to help control the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Huge line forms outside Las Vegas casino but it's not to gamble
item.description: Laid-off workers are lining up in front of a Las Vegas casino to get food, as a result of the economic crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Kyung Lah reports.

item.title: The oil bankruptcies are just beginning
In some US states, unemployment can pay more than lost jobs
item.description: While unemployment benefits serve as a financial lifeline for those who lose their jobs, the program typically replaces only about 40% of workers' wages, on average.

item.title: Outrage as beach is sprayed with bleach
item.description: A local official in southern Spain has apologized after spraying beaches with bleach, which caused outrage among environmentalists.

item.title: Katie Couric recalls uncomfortable interview with Denzel Washington
item.description: Journalist Katie Couric recounted the story of her 2004 "Dateline" interview with actor Denzel Washington that she said left her feeling shaken.

item.title: US Navy stages back-to-back challenges to Beijing's South China Sea claims
item.description: A United States Navy warship conducted a "freedom of navigation operation" Wednesday aimed in part at challenging China's claims in the South China Sea, the second such operation in as many days near disputed islands that the US has accused Beijing of militarizing.

item.title: 'A little bit of a breather': Lagos Governor promises smarter interventions as lockdown eases
item.description: Lockdown restrictions will be eased in Lagos, the state's governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu confirmed in a public address Wednesday.

item.title: Duchess of Sussex's gives advice to an internship seeker
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex Meghan Markle offered advice to a woman preparing for an internship interview during a recent video call. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: Jada Pinkett Smith says she discovered she doesn't know husband Will Smith at all
item.description: Jada Pinkett Smith has been married to Will Smith for 23 years, but after being quarantined with him, she's realized she doesn't know him at all.

item.title: How to combat weight gain during the pandemic (beyond diet and exercise)
item.description: Quarantine life is challenging, to say the least, and all of us are struggling mentally, emotionally and physically. And no one would blame you for being tempted to abandon your diet and exercise plan and reach for the tub of ice cream while binge-watching that tiger show that everyone is talking about.

item.title: PSG crowned French Ligue 1 champion after season canceled
item.description: Paris Saint-Germain has been named French Ligue 1 champion by France's Ligue de Football Professionnel after the remainder of the season was canceled because of the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Britney Spears says she accidentally burned down her home gym -- oops
item.description: Her dance moves are red hot, her style is sizzling. But always one to fan the flames of pop culture, Britney Spears has announced that she accidentally burned down her home gym.

item.title: Couple arranged their virtual wedding in 2 hours
item.description: He can't stop kissing the bride after couple ties the knot on Zoom. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: The personal stories of 3 enslaved Africans, as told by their bones
item.description: Despite the wealth of knowledge regarding the transatlantic slave trade, the history of enslaved Africans forcibly brought to Latin America has yet to be fully explored.

item.title: Auction offers rare Prohibition-era barware designed to avoid detection
item.description: To mark 100 years since the start of Prohibition, Sotheby's is putting some of the era's barware up for auction, including ingenious items designed to deceive the authorities.

item.title: Actress caught using restroom on 'Zoom' call
item.description: Tiffany Haddish recounts taking a bathroom break in the middle of a "Zoom" meeting, and not realizing that she could be seen by other callers in the meeting.

item.title: This animated monster is teaching children about coronavirus
item.description: How do you explain coronavirus to children? Make a cartoon!

item.title: Comedian documents her experience in Israeli 'Coronavirus Hotel'
item.description: Comedian Noam Shuster documented her experience recovering from Covid-19 while living in a hotel full of strangers in Israel. See how they became her live audience.

item.title: Where did it go wrong for the UK on coronavirus?
item.description: Get info: UK falls short | Countries loosen restrictions

item.title: Johnson hints Britons will be asked to wear masks
Wuhan shows world that normal might still be a long way off
item.description: All around the world, people are waiting for the announcement that the coronavirus pandemic is contained and they can return to normal life.

item.title: Fauci touts drug's 'clear cut' ability to aid Covid-19 recovery
item.description: • Small China study finds remdesivir did not help patients

item.title: Trump and Kushner show depth of disconnect with Americans on the front lines
item.description: • Hilton CEO shatters Trump's testing conspiracy theory while sitting beside him • Analysis: Kushner's tone-deaf remark missed the mark

item.title: Russian Prime Minister tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: • Anger rises among Russia's doctors as coronavirus hospitals get put on lockdown

item.title: Deaths soar in country that didn't lock down. Officials identify big reason why.
